data.title: VSCode checks Git changes so often
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|path-autocomplete|ionutvmi|1.4.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|
|filenamecomplete|qinjia|0.0.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|
|autoimport|steoates|1.2.2|;


---

Hi,

I've noted this issue because running "git rebase -i HEAD~8" stops notifying ".git/index.lock" file exist

Sometimes the rebase work takes a while to complete, so it's rebuilding several files to convert several commits into one commit

If VSCode runs the check while rebase is processing, it places the file index.lock, making the rebase to crash

I watch in VSCode runs the check near 2 times per second at th is time.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3185892/24966427/e1173910-1f74-11e7-9314-d916d3811f5b.png)

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run VS Code, 
2. save severals files into severals commits
3. run "git rebase -i" from Git Bash

data.title: Using keystrokes in Explorer
data.body:
A nice addition to the Explorer would be the ability to use keystrokes to navigate through folders/files.

In a standard Windows/MacOS explorer, whenever you start typing a file/folder name, the pointer travels to the file/folder with letters beginning with whatever you've typed.

Having that in VSCode's explorer could help navigate throughout the app and the file system using only the keyboards faster.

data.title: Theming for tree and list
data.body:
I have split this up into two commits: 
* first: introduction of dynamic CSS in tree and list
* second: adoption throughout the workbench

@joaomoreno @aeschli please review and merge if you are good (I am out tomorrow). 

The CSS is created as child of the tree/list container (as discussed). Still ugly that we generate lots of CSS when it would be nicer if we could style elements directly.

data.title: Can't debug latest Node 8 nightlies
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2/pull/99

The `--inspect --debug-brk` option works from Node 6.3 through 7.x. The `--inspect-brk` option works from 7.6.0 through 8.x. `--debug-brk` was just removed: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/12197. Hopefully it will be put back for backwards compatibility - https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/12364. Otherwise, VS Code 1.11 won't be able to debug Node 8 which is an issue.

data.title: NVDA is very silient on VS Code

NVDA is very silent on VSCode right now. Tabbing through button (side bar, search UI, ...) doesn't read anything. Nor does it read something in the editor itself. This used to work IMO.

data.title: Git version < 1.9 spam
data.body:
If I have an older git installed I always get the message box warning that I should update to a newer version.
This is very frustrating, especially since I see it on every vscode start.
Please add a 'don't ask me again' or something to hide it forever. Or simply show this warning only once

data.title: [debugger] argc and argv are wrong when set multiple arguments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z)

---
When debug code with launch mode, in function "main()", the "argc" is awalys 2 when set some arguments.

E.g.

launch.json
      "program": "/media/lifeng/ocean/llvm/llvm-3.7.0.src/builder/bin/llc ",
      "args": ["mytest.ll -print-after-all"],

Expect:
    argc: 3;
    argv[0]: /media/lifeng/ocean/llvm/llvm-3.7.0.src/builder/bin/llc
    argv[1]: mytest.ll
    argv[2]: -print-after-all

data.title: Terminal - yarn progress rendering has glitches

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
To reproduce run `yarn upgrade` or install in a project on Windows. Notice how the progress bar is rendered on top of the previous line:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/24962875/6c21d268-1f9d-11e7-8fcd-5ace48be757f.png)

Running the same command inside the console doesn't have this glitch

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/24962919/87ed5080-1f9d-11e7-9bfd-78f1a6084698.png)

hyper has the same problem, so it is likely an upstream term issue
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/24980393/46588bc2-1fd8-11e7-9f89-2eccbe497cc3.png)

For some reason, `"Word` is treated as a keyword, therefore this and all further strings in a file are not highlighted as strings (but spaces between them are).

data.title: Mouse cursor changed to 'copy', is not reverting back
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12-insider
- OS Version: 66546c

I was editing some code, and at some point in time, the cursor became a weird symbol - an arrow with a plus at it's top-right. I inspected, and it's coming from: 


```css
.monaco-editor.hc-black.mac.mouse-copy .view-lines, .monaco-editor.mouse-copy .view-lines, .monaco-editor.vs-dark.mac.mouse-copy .view-lines {
  cursor: copy
}
```
with the `.monaco-editor.mouse-copy .view-lines` being the active class.

I don't understand how the editor went into that state. When I open a new file, the normal `text` cursor shows up.

data.title: Have a setting to prevent auto trim whitespace on cursor line
data.body:
Add an option to **prevent** **auto trim** whitespace from acting on the **cursor line**.
It is very annoying when I change focus in the middle of typing something and switch back and see my inserted space behind the cursor is gone and I have to hit space again.
hint: _Atom_ has this feature.

data.title: Markdown preview - monospace font
data.body:
Markdown preview does not have a setting for mono font.  It also does not pick up any changes to the `editor.fontFamily` setting.  My olds eyes prefer Roboto Mono.

Would be helpful, since a lot of markdown includes code snippets, etc...

Or, have I missed something?

Otherwise, thanks for the markdown support.

[Ruby, Rails, & AWS-Ruby Docs](https://msp-greg.github.io/)

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Win7

data.title: Disable `translate3D` for list when scaling
data.body:
Related to #13662

Check d2a5c57366f29f0366ce479e8443506dc1bfb5e1

---

In order to get subpixel antialias with `translate3d`, the dom element also needs an opaque background color. Since this would introduce an odd option to the list, we're simply gonna disable that optimization for Windows, while leaving it for the other platforms.

data.title: PHP syntax highlighting breaks when \x7f-\xff is used as label
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0 - Extensions: none --- PHP syntax highlighting breaks when non letter/number/underscore is used as label From http://www.php.net/manual/en/functions.user-defined.php: > Function names follow the same rules as other labels in PHP > ... > As a regular expression, it would be expressed thus: [a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]* E.g. using the section symbol `§` (`\xa7`) Note, these rules apply to labels other than functions too, like variables etc... (highlighting breaks when \x7f-\xff is used in variables, and probably other places too).

data.title: Unable to use preLaunchTask with two configurations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create two watching task using typescript compiler named srv and web in tasks.json.
2. In launch.json create three configurations: 
      - srv for node with preLaunchTask=srv 
      - web from chrome with preLaunchTask=web
      - compound launch named both, which starts both launch configurations: srv and web

If I start srv debugging all works ok. But if I then start web debugging I get "There is a task srv running. Can not run pre launch task web." Same happens if I start compound task named both.

But I'm able to run both tasks srv and web at the same time if I start them with Run task command. Of course, I must remove preLaunchTask, if I want to start debugging, otherwise I get same error.

br

data.title: Tab size and space / tab settings annoying behaviour.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have tab indent size set at 2 and using spaces in both my **User** and **Workspace** settings. If I open a file created elsewhere (project generator created files for example) that have tab indentation of 4, I would expect to be able to just hit **SHIFT-ALT F** to format that document and have my tab settings applied. This does not happen. I have to go to the tab size indicator in VS Codes status bar, click on that and select **'Indent Using Spaces'** and then click on **'2 Configured Tab Size'**.

This then allows me to use SHIFT-ALT F to apply my preferred tab sizes to most file types but, confusingly, this does not seem to work for **.cshtml** files, which seem to insist on retaining whatever tab size they were created with.

Is this intended behaviour?

data.title: No warning when a comment is used inside an extension's package.json
data.body: The package.json for an extension doesn't support comments. However, when I add a comment I don't get a warning in the editor, I only get a warning when I try to run the extension.

data.title: Function Breakpoints - does not hit selected function
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
Visual Studio Code - Insiders
Version 1.12.0-insider
Commit 66546c13343f71e3055ce4866d994223f0a811ac
Date 2017-04-12T06:11:15.687Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

- OS Version: 
Windows 10 - 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create Function breakpoint 
2. Select (check) function breakpoint  prior to executing code
3. Start debugging - and it does not hit the breakpoint.
3.1. It hits the breakpoint if function breakpoint is selected (checked) during code execution;

Also
If function name is changed in code and the function breakpoint's remain with the same name it continues to hit the same break.

Please find attached code:
[demo.pdf](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/916205/demo.pdf)

data.title: Is it possible to configure Babun/ZSH for the integrated terminal on Windows?
data.body:
This is "working":

```json
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Users\\Username\\.babun\\cygwin\\bin\\mintty.exe",
"terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": [
    "/bin/env",
    "CHERE_INVOKING=1",
    "/bin/zsh.exe"
],
```

The only problem is that a new window is opened instead of the integrated terminal.

The command and arguments were taken from [here](http://babun.github.io/faq.html#_how_do_i_integrate_babun_with_conemu_cmder).

Does anyone if it's possible to have the ZSH shell on the integrated terminal and on Windows?

data.title: Vscode keeps opening same protected file at (cold) launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. unclear

Issue:

VSC keeps opening the same file when it's cold launched.
It's a file that vscode does not have the rights to edit.
(it's an config.plist file)

I opened it once with vscode then shut down the mac without really closing vscode itself.

I think there is an bug with the hotExit feature or something similar.

I tried completely removing vscode and all related files, but this annoyance still persists.

Please help..

data.title: Make the currently active editor more distinguishable from others
data.body:
As a user of a large screen space (two monitors) I keep my editor in one side and several terminal windows on the other side.

When my eyes swift from the editor the the terminals and back again, I would like a "very obvious" visual hint of which was the tab I was working on.

Currently all tabs look equally important, but I would greatly appreciate a clear visualization of the active tab

Some random thoughts:

- only the active tab should highlight the current line

- syntax in the active tab should "stronger" than in the non active tabs. Non active tabs should have a "weaker" visual, but maybe not to the point of making them blurry

- The active tab should look very - more different than tabs in the same group (and other groups too)

data.title: #22987 markdown breaks
data.body:
issue #22987
vscode should add a option to control markdown breaks
